title: Citibank Launches New Value Proposition to Meet the Needs of Emerging Affluent Clients in China
summary: Shanghai – Citibank China Co., Ltd. ("Citi China") announced today a new platform catering to the emerging affluent in China. The new proposition aims to provide these customers with a greater level of convenience and personalization, as well as privileged global banking services.
tag-1: Citibank Launches New Value Proposition to Meet the Needs of Emerging Affluent Clients in China
tag-2: Shanghai – Citibank China Co., Ltd. ("Citi China") announced today a new platform catering to the emerging affluent in China. The new proposition aims to provide these customers with a greater level of convenience and personalization, as well as privileged global banking services.
tag-3: "As more people enter into the emerging affluent category in China, we are seeing a change in this group's lifestyles, needs and aspirations," said Anand Selva, Country Business Manager, Citi China. "Emerging affluent customers are aspirational and want a banking partner that suits their lifestyles, giving them the ability to bank when, where and how they want to. The launch of this platform adds to our ability to serve this customer segment following the introduction of our Smart Banking outlets in China last year, which provide customers with a digital, convenient banking experience that is helping redefine retail banking in China."
tag-4: Citibank defines the emerging affluent as those with annual income of more than RMB 200,000 or investable assets over RMB 500,000. In China, It is an increasingly important segment that is expected to grow at 15 percent per year over the next 10 years. The new proposition is centered around three pillars:
tag-5: The enhanced Citibanking value proposition is the latest element of Citibank's strategy to cater to clients in every segment, giving them a set of customized value propositions as they grow in wealth and sophistication of financial needs – from the emerging affluent (Citibanking), to the affluent (Citigold), to high-net-worth individuals (Citigold Private Client).
tag-6: The launch of the new Citibanking proposition is the result of a series of focus groups conducted by Citibank China in Shanghai and Beijing last year, which revealed that:
tag-7: "Our research shows that emerging affluent clients want a bank that provides professional and customized advice that is responsive and easily accessed. These clients also value global connectivity as they lead increasingly global lifestyles and want a bank to offer them the support to meet their evolving needs. The new proposition we have launched today delivers new service standards along all of these dimensions," added Anand Selva.
tag-8: As one of the fastest-growing markets in the financial services industry, the emerging affluent segment in Asia is a key priority for Citibank in the region. Similar propositions for the emerging affluent segment have been launched in Singapore and Hong Kong earlier this year, and Citibank China's launch marks a broader rollout planned for the region.
tag-9: Citibank is the leading consumer bank in Asia Pacific with more than 31 million retail and card customer accounts and has pioneered the use of internet and mobile banking across Asia. Citibank is the largest wealth manager in Asia Pacific with over USD 185 billion assets under management.
tag-10: Citi Citi, a leading global financial services company, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management. Additional information may be found at www.citigroup.com.
tag-11: Citi China  Citi first established an office in China on May 15, 1902, in Shanghai. In April 2007, Citi was among the first international banks to locally incorporate in China. Citi's locally incorporated entity is known as Citibank (China) Co Ltd, which is wholly owned by Citibank N.A. Today Citi is a leading international bank in China, and has eleven corporate bank branches - in Beijing, Shanghai, Guangzhou, Shenzhen, Tianjin, Chengdu, Hangzhou, Dalian, Chongqing, Guiyang and Nanjing - and thirty-six consumer bank outlets. With operations in more than 160 countries around the world, Citi is the most global of all international banks in China.
